attributes.action: not tax works pensions under £15,000 pa and to allow the surviving wife or husband after the recipient of the pension has died to receive the full pension and not only a fraction of it and, also, to allow the State pension to be paid to the surviving wife or husband after the death of the recipient and for it, also, not to be taxed
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: I am appalled that my measly pension from my work of just under £10,000 pa is actually taxed. My wife and I cannot live off that sum.  When I die my wife will receive just over half that amount.  When I qualify for State pension we may be able to breathe but when I die she will not get even that at all.  Yet, the Government can find billions of pounds from somewhere to pump into the system when the great brains earning six figure salaries who are responsible for the economy fail and then, themselves, receive massive pensions. I want my wife to continue receiving my full pensions, both from work as well as State pension and, also, for neither pension to be taxed at all.
